title: How to improve behaviour? (while not being passive)
body:
I recently had some non-ban situation regarding my In game behavior.
and since we have freedom of thought and speech, is there any way I can improve my behavior without being entirely passive/mute all?
because some people DO communicate with the chat feature.

replies.body: This game isn't covered by freedom of speech "rights", its owned property by riot games. They set the rules, and can do what they see fit to inforce them.

> [{quoted}](name=Kei143,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Hb8bFVew,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2018-04-06T03:53:57.256+0000)
>
> So you are asking for advice on how to respond to flamers without getting punished?

I'm not talking about using language to get AROUND the system, but ways to respond logically and respectfully (even though they don't deserve it)

Hmm...

For people giving up and saying "gg I'm  done" you can tell them "far from it", and give them a game plan on how to win.

If they are flaming yo u cos of a bad play, you can tell them to relax, and it was a bad decision at the moment, you could probably mention the correct play as well.

If people are flaming you cos you didn't go in and trade while they did (and probably died for it), then just tell them that you though it was a bad idea to join.

If they keep flaming you and saying that they'll report you, then just say "k" and ignore them.

If they start using hate speech, then I tell that such speech isn't tolerated in Lol and his account can get banned for it.

If they are flaming others and asking people to report others, then you can tell them that continuing such behavior will get them punished if they kept going and they probably should stop.

If 2 people are flaming each other, then tell them to mute each other and focus on the game.

If they keep flaming after all that, then I just ignore them (but I don't mute them).

You can't. Once you've played league long enough and seen all "walks of life" in games. Your tolerance for stupid people/plays really goes down. Played league for 5 years, now im playing it less and less because all it does is stress me out, because I have to worry about the idiotic new players who dont understand the game fucking the game to the point where no matter how good i play or what it say will change the outcome.

Everyone gets mad at their teammates, but some people just don't have the mechanical skill they need to defeat their opponent. Sometimes they miss a ping and didn't get the info you gave them, or they miss a smite, or a crucial skillshot because they aren't focused on the game due to real-world issues. 

You don't know what other players are thinking or how they are feeling, so there isn't a need to blast them. Either bottle your frustrations or vent them away from your teammates. Flaming ALWAYS either makes players perform worse due to pressure or makes players angry enough to throw leads and int.
Just swear at your teammates in real life. They can't hear you there. As long as you don't make your feelings known to your team, you won't have any issue.
